name: Lena Morales
description: Lena Morales is a 39-year-old project manager and mother of two (5th and 9th grade) in a mid-sized, transit-friendly city. Methodical and data-driven, she researches district, magnet, IB, and charter programs, comparing course sequences, bell schedules, graduation pathways, and extracurricular fit. She maintains a shared family calendar and uses spreadsheets to align transportation, aftercare, and homework routines with each school’s schedule. She prioritizes evidence of student support (tutoring availability, counseling caseloads, teacher stability) and values programs that balance rigor with well-being. Lena communicates proactively with counselors and program coordinators, scheduling tours, information nights, and shadow days well ahead of deadlines. She watches for policy changes and enrollment windows, noting pain points like fragmented websites and last-minute calendar shifts. Budget-conscious, she plans for fees, testing, and supplies, and coordinates carpools to reduce commute time. Outside of research, she decompresses with early-morning runs and volunteers at school events, building relationships that keep her in the loop.
example_behaviours: Builds side-by-side comparison spreadsheets for IB vs. AP pathways, elective sequences, and bell schedules.
Color-codes a shared Google Calendar for classes, practices, testing dates, and early-release days.
Sets alerts for district board meetings and enrollment deadlines; skims agendas for calendar changes.
Emails counselors quarterly with concise updates and course-planning questions.
Schedules campus tours and attends open houses, noting tutoring hours, counseling availability, and transportation options.
Tests school commutes at drop-off time to measure real travel time and parking constraints.
Organizes a neighborhood carpool and rotates after-school study group hosting.
Uses Trello/Notion to track application tasks, immunization records, and required forms.
Volunteers as a science fair mentor and PTSA committee member to understand program culture.
Runs 5K routes at dawn and meal-preps on Sundays to keep weeknights open for homework blocks.
